column1: Tantrums are more likely to occur in younger children or others who cannot express their needs or control their emotions when they are frustrated.
WHEN YOUR CHILD HAS A TANTRUM When your child has a temper tantrum, it is important that you stay calm.
You are not a bad parent, and your son or daughter is not a bad child.
If your child has a tantrum away from home, lead your child to a quiet place, such as the car or a rest room.
If your child no longer takes a nap, ensure that he or she still has some quiet time.
